Who
we are
At Miami Theater Center our diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace is one where all employees and volunteers, whatever their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation or identity, education or differing abilities, feel fully valued and respected. MTC is committed to a nondiscriminatory approach to staffing and provides equal opportunities for employment and advancement throughout the organization. MTC respects and values diverse life experiences, perspectives and heritages, and ensures that all voices are valued and heard. We’re committed to modeling diversity and inclusion for the entire arts industry of the nonprofit sector, and to maintaining an inclusive environment with equitable treatment for all. Miami Theater Center sees diversity, inclusion, and equity as deeply and essentially connected to our mission and critical to ensuring the well-being of our staff and the communities we serve.
MTC Staff
VICTORIA ROW-TRASTER
ARTISTIC DIRECTOR
Victoria Row-Traster is Miami Theater Center’s Artistic Director and curates live-performance and film presented at MTC. Row-Traster also oversees all partnerships and educational programs, creates arts curriculum and facilitates the professional development for the MTC Teaching Artist Ensemble who deliver high-quality education programs supported by the work on MTC’s main stage.
Previous to this, Row-Traster was a member of the Primary and Early Years Program developing at The Royal National Theatre, London delivering arts curriculum connected to the main-stage and touring productions for four seasons, and Curriculum and Publications Manager at The New Victory Theater, New York for 5 seasons. Row-Traster received a Post Graduate Certificate in Education from The Central School of Speech and Drama, London, and Master of Arts in Educational Theatre from NYU Steinhardt, New York.
YOLIMA DE AVILA
MANAGING DIRECTOR
Yoli is the glue that holds MTC together since 2008. She quickly became instrumental in organizing grants, meetings and events. With progressive responsibility, she transitioned into the role of general manager and did an outstanding job keeping up with our building (circa 1946) and introduced renting the venue as another source of income. To date, she has added an extra $200,000 to our budget for continued Educational programming.
As Managing Director of MTC, she brings strong organizational skills and knowledge of the non-profit industry. She coordinates with our Grant writers and has strong writing and editing skills. She plays a key role in ensuring our organization uses its financial resources in the most effective ways possible. She works with other department managers to develop and approve workable budgets, expenditures, and improve our marketing efforts. Yoli holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Business from Florida International University.
EVENTZ PAUL
TECHNICAL DIRECTOR
Eventz Paul serves as the Technical Director at the Miami Theater Center (MTC) and is also the Productions Manager for Miami Light Project (MLP), an organization housed within MTC. He joined MLP in 2011 and initially participated in their Technical Fellowship Program to enhance his theater skills, benefiting from mentorship by industry experts. Eventz has since become a respected leader in Miami's technical field, collaborating with various arts organizations and venues, including the National Young Arts Foundation and the Colony Theatre. He now shares his expertise by instructing audiovisual classes for incoming technical fellows, contributing to the development of future professionals in the industry.
TERRENCE BRUNN
EDUCATION MANAGER
A native of St. Thomas, USVI, Terrence Brunn is an arts administrator and designer with a B.A. in Business Management from the University of Miami. Terrence is the program coordinator for Miami Theater Center, facilitating artistic and education programs for young people. Prior to MTC, Terrence worked with Miami Light Project, a not-for-profit organization that presents live performances by celebrated dance, music, visual and theater artists. Terrence currently resides in Miami and enjoys traveling when not working.
MANUEL & MIGUEL BONILLA
FACILITY MANAGERS
Manuel and Miguel Bonilla are Cuban-American twin actors and MTC's Facilities Managers. Their day-to-day tasks include leading tours for potential renters, while simultaneously upkeeping and maintaining the overall standard of the mid-century theater. Both FIU graduates with BFA's in Acting, Manuel and Miguel's long and winded journey grows by the day, and has allowed them to transform into multi-functional artists with aspirations and capabilities of creating work within the ever-growing theater community of Miami. Some of their passions include, basketball, film, and confusing people into thinking they're the same person.
NIA NICHOLS
ASSISTANT TECHNICAL DIRECTOR
Nia plays with light and color whilst programming the lighting board. She also assists Eventz during productions, and the day-to-day technical upkeep. Following a Bachelor of Arts in Theater from FIU, she participated in the Technical Fellowship at Miami Light Project, and subsequently worked there for many years. She loves creating art, writing, acting, funning, travelling, reading, cooking, baking and food history.
Partnerships
The Adrienne Arsht Center
To engage and connect people from every corner of our community through artistic excellence and inspiring educational experiences.
Culture Shock Miami
An audience development program of the Miami-Dade County Department of Cultural Affairs is designed to introduce the next generation of audience members to live arts and cultural experiences when they are beginning to make their own entertainment decisions.
Lotus House
An organization dedicated to improving the lives of homeless women, youth and children. We provide sanctuary, support, education, tools and resources that empower them to heal, learn, grow and blossom into who they are truly meant to be.
Miami Lighthouse for the Blind and Visually Impaired
In collaboration with Miami-Dade County Public Schools and the Early Learning Coalition offers an inclusion environment for toddlers and Pre-K children age three and four years old (50% visually impaired and 50% typically developing sighted children).
Miami Lighthouse is the first vision rehabilitation educational institute in the U.S. using the international HighScope Curriculum, and this is the first time that the HighScope has been applied to blind learners in a fully inclusive model.
Miami Light Project
Founded in 1989, Miami Light Project is a not-for-profit cultural organization that presents live performances by innovative dance, music, and theater artists from around the world; supports the development of new work by South Florida-based artists; and offers educational programs for students of every age.
Nicklaus Children’s Hospital
Over the decades, the hospital has touched – and often transformed – the lives of countless children and families and supported them throughout their healthcare journey. As we celebrated this milestone birthday, we also embraced a new name and logo. We are now Nicklaus Children’s Hospital, in recognition of a generous pledge from the Nicklaus Children’s Health Care Foundation.
O Cinema
Located in the heart of the historic Art Deco District, O Cinema South Beach brings the best in Independent, Foreign, and Art Films to South Florida audiences year-round.
South Florida PBS
South Florida PBS,
Florida’s largest public media company, connects organizations and institutions across our region and preserves South Florida's history. SOUTH FLORIDA PBS is committed to creating and presenting unique arts, education and cultural heritage programming, and serves as a model for telling unique local stories across a wide variety of media platforms.
Moss Center
The Moss Center presents national and international artists in music, dance, and theater to the community of South Miami-Dade. The Center also engages in extensive outreach and education initiatives.
WLRN
The Mission of WLRN Public Radio and Television is to provide information, entertainment, and learning services with a commitment to excellence in serving local, national and international communities.

Support
MTC
In
Jun
e
, a $32 million cut to state funding for the arts was enacted, significantly impacting MTC, which has relied on a generous grant from this funding every year since our formation. The effects of these cuts are profound; without this crucial support, MTC faces severe financial challenges that will affect our ability to continue providing the diverse and vital programs our community depends on. To help us overcome these challenges, we kindly ask for your support through donations to ensure we can continue our mission and serve our community.
If you embrace our passion for sharing the magic of great theater with everyone, and want to play a role in bringing exceptional theatrical works and educational opportunities to our communities, then we welcome your donations. Won’t you consider supporting our productions, education programs, and our community engagement initiatives? Partner with us in making MTC everyone’s home for theater and culture.
$500 send a kid to camp
$100 bring a family to see a performance
$250 you can sponsor an InSchool workshop
$250-$1,000 Host a film or monthly film series
$ any amount – Support us in repairing our A/C Unit
$50-$1,000 – Support our OnCall program sending teaching artists to bring joy to kids in hospital.
Donate Now
MTC is delighted to offer corporate sponsors a variety of exciting benefits, including ticket packages and discounts, unique experiences and events, and incredible brand visibility. By sponsoring MTC, a company supports our mission to create transformational live arts experiences and educational opportunities for people of all ages, abilities, and cultures and socioeconomic backgrounds, and to provide affordable rehearsal, performance, and screen facilities for artists and arts organizations.
$10,000 Season Sponsor
$5,000 Family Series Sponsor
$2,500 Spotlight Sponsor
$1,000 Education Program Sponsor
Get the Sponsorship Deck
Did you know MTC has pre-show on-screen advertising opportunities available? Imagine having an attentive, captive and local audience watching your ad! Showcase your business in Miami Shores. Please send all inquiries to yolima@mtcmiami.org!
$120 One Spot in One Films
$160 One Spot in Two Films
$160 Two Spots in One Film
$200 One Spot in Three Films
$200 Two Spots in Two Films
Buy Spots
